content: ulla mittens are practical every day mittens which can also be used as lining for other mittens to make extra thick and toasty winter mittens they are knitted in traditional norwegian shape but without colourwork they knit up fast and are excellent practice for those who wants to learn how to knit this type of mittens without having to worry about the colourwork the pattern has one size that can be adjusted by changing gauge this is done by using thicker/thinner yarn and/or needles to achieve desired gauge it is recommended to knit a sample swatch if the swatch has too many stitches in 10 cm go up a needle size if the swatch has too few stitches in 10 cm go down a needle size link to video instructions in the pattern **suggested yarn ** viking eco highland wool / dale lanolin wool / rauma finull other yarn can be used choose yarn that gives desired gauge **yarn amount ** 100 g for mittens larger than described in measurements more yarn is needed **suggested needles ** pattern is written using 5 double pointed needles size 3 mm different needle sizes may be needed for different gauge or if you don t hit gauge using recommended needle size **gauge ** 24-26 sts = 10 cm in stranded colourwork **sizes ** one size see measurements **measurements in cm ** length cuff 8 across hand when gauge is 24 26 sts in 10 cm 11 5 11 full length 30 thumb from base to tip 7 for other sizes adjust gauge norsk praktisk og varm hverdagsvott som også kan brukes som fôr i andre votter for å få ekstra tykke og varme vintervotter ullavotter er strikket som en tradisjonell norsk
